pullRequest.body:
Formalize Pareto distribution, using Gamma distribution as a reference.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [180bac198f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16713/commits/180bac198fa6f7ee9b69e55cddec3283b92e522c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Distributions.Pareto`|1931|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ isProbabilityMeasure_paretoMeasure`
`+ lintegral_paretoPDF_eq_one`
`+ lintegral_paretoPDF_of_le`
`+ measurable_paretoPDFReal`
`+ paretoCDFReal_eq_integral`
`+ paretoCDFReal_eq_lintegral`
`+ paretoMeasure`
`+ paretoPDF`
`+ paretoPDFReal`
`+ paretoPDFReal_nonneg`
`+ paretoPDFReal_pos`
`+ paretoPDF_eq`
`+ paretoPDF_of_le`
`+ paretoPDF_of_lt`
`+ stronglyMeasurable_paretoPDFReal`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
@EtienneC30 Fixed!
@EtienneC30 fixed again!
@RemyDegenne Fixed! Are there any other changes I should add before we can merge this?

Thanks!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11057467401/job/30721313707)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11057467401/job/30721313058)
This seems all right to me! Now we need a maintainer to allow merging.
That's a great job! My comments are mostly small details.
A few more details in the doc, and some advice on the proof style.
This seems all right to me! Now we need a maintainer to allow merging.
It looks good! Only two final comments from me, and then we can merge this.

**[lint-style (comment with "bot fix style" to have the bot commit all style suggestions)]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion 0 < paretoPDFReal t r x := by ```
bot fix style
This also works if `t = 0` or `r = 0` with a bit more case-splitting.

Please add a full stop in your docstrings
```suggestion
/-- The pdf of the Pareto distribution depending on its scale and rate. -/
```

The hypothesis refers to `lt` rather than `neg` so I think this is better:
```suggestion
lemma paretoPDF_of_lt {t r x : ℝ} (hx : x < t) : paretoPDF t r x = 0 := by
```

```suggestion
lemma paretoPDF_of_le {t r x : ℝ} (hx : t ≤ x) :
```

Please make this change in every docstring.
```suggestion
Define the Pareto measure over the reals.
```

You can assume `x ≤ t` with no change in the proof.
```suggestion
lemma lintegral_paretoPDF_of_le {t r x : ℝ} (hx : x ≤ t) :
```

You can now just do
```suggestion
  have leftSide : ∫⁻ x in Iio t, paretoPDF t r x = 0 := lintegral_paretoPDF_of_le (le_refl t)
```

A bit shorter:
```suggestion
  · rw [integral_Ici_eq_integral_Ioi, integral_mul_left, integral_Ioi_rpow_of_lt _ ht]
    · field_simp [hr]
      rw [mul_assoc, ← rpow_add ht]
      simp
```

```suggestion
    simp_rw [paretoPDFReal, eq_true_intro hx, ite_true]
 
end ParetoPDF
```

This doesn't hurt
```suggestion
@[measurability, fun_prop]
lemma measurable_paretoPDFReal (t r : ℝ) : Measurable (paretoPDFReal t r) :=
```

```suggestion
@[measurability, fun_prop]
 lemma stronglyMeasurable_paretoPDFReal (t r : ℝ) :
```
I get a "unrecognized function property" when I try to do this here. the previous occurrence works though
Ah, this will be because strong measurability is not conisdered as something that should be proved with `fun_prop` leave it as it is then.

Just a detail but I think this is more common, same below
```suggestion
noncomputable def paretoPDFReal (t r x : ℝ) : ℝ :=
```

Once you changed the hypothesis of `paretoPDFReal_nonneg`, you can do
```suggestion
  · exact ae_of_all _ fun b ↦ by simp only [Pi.zero_apply, paretoPDFReal_nonneg ht.le hr.le]
```

```suggestion
/-- The pdf of the Pareto distribution depending on its scale and rate. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The pdf of the Pareto distribution, as a function valued in `ℝ≥0∞`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The Lebesgue integral of the Pareto pdf over reals `≤ t` equals `0`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The Pareto pdf is positive for all reals `≥ t`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The pdf of the Pareto distribution integrates to `1`. -/
```

The double `simp only` is not very satisfactory, this is nicer I think.
```suggestion
lemma paretoCDFReal_eq_lintegral {t r : ℝ} (ht : 0 < t) (hr : 0 < r) (x : ℝ) :
    paretoCDFReal t r x = ENNReal.toReal (∫⁻ x in Iic x, paretoPDF t r x) := by
  have : IsProbabilityMeasure (paretoMeasure t r) := isProbabilityMeasurePareto ht hr
  rw [paretoCDFReal, cdf_eq_toReal, paretoMeasure, withDensity_apply _ measurableSet_Iic]
```

```suggestion
  scale `t` and shape `r` (when `ht : 0 < t` and `hr : 0 < r`).
```

Please avoid multiline tactic blocks in the arguments of a theorem. Use `apply` or `refine` instead.
```suggestion
   refine ae_of_all _ fun x (hx : t ≤ x) ↦ ?_
   have := lt_of_lt_of_le ht hx
   positivity
```

```suggestion
lemma isProbabilityMeasure_paretoMeasure {t r : ℝ} (ht : 0 < t) (hr : 0 < r) :
    IsProbabilityMeasure (paretoMeasure t r) where
```

Bad indent
```suggestion
@[measurability]
lemma stronglyMeasurable_paretoPDFReal (t r : ℝ) :
    StronglyMeasurable (paretoPDFReal t r) :=
  (measurable_paretoPDFReal t r).stronglyMeasurable
```

```suggestion
/-- The pdf of the Pareto distribution depending on its scale `t` and rate `r`. -/
```
(assuming I got those correct).
fixed
You use `{t r x : ℝ}` often in this file, so you should add a line `variable {t r x : ℝ}` at the start of the file (after `namespace ProbabilityTheory`) and remove those from the lemmas.
Makes sense, fixing
I don't think this definition is useful. It should be removed. You could simply use `cdf (paretoMeasure t r)` in the lemmas.
I did this because Gamma.lean had a similar approach. Fixing now

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Probability/Distributions): formalize Pareto distribution
